meanings.definition: To hit or strike someone or something with force.
meanings.sent1: He was schmucking the ball with all his might.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter was schmucking the nail into the wood.
meanings.sent3: The boxer was schmucking the punching bag like a pro.
meanings.sent4: The storm was schmucking the coast with powerful waves.
meanings.sent5: The hammer was schmucking the nail into place.

meanings.sent1: She was schmucking her friend into believing a funny story.
meanings.sent2: The magician was schmucking the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent3: The fox was schmucking the crow into dropping the cheese.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was schmucking people out of their money.
meanings.sent5: The prankster was schmucking his classmates with a fake spider.

meanings.definition: Used as an intensifier to express strong emotion or emphasis.
meanings.sent1: She was schmucking happy to see her best friend.
meanings.sent2: He was schmucking tired after running a marathon.
meanings.sent3: The child was schmucking excited to open his birthday presents.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was schmucking proud of her students' hard work.
meanings.sent5: The singer was schmucking loudly during the concert.
